medium: Molded paper and paper products, hand-colored and spray varnished
title: #25 Lavender
marks: Signature, Title, Date, and Stamp Signed and dated at one edge of green paper, in pe
text:
British modernist Anthony Caro has played a pivotal role in the development of 
twentieth-century sculpture. Known for his innovative use of assembled industrial 
material such as bronze, steel, iron, lead, stone, wood, and paper, he typically produces large-scale abstract sculptures that rest directly on the ground, inviting the viewer to engage directly with them. The molded paper multiple #25 Lavender is one of a series of related small-scale sculptures he produced in collaboration with master printer Ken Tyler at Tyler Graphics. Each sculpture is unique and was formed, painted and varnished by hand.
description: paper construction with black, lavender, white and green paper and black foamcore; cut-away cube shape with torn, rolled and folded lavender, black and white paper at center of shape; green square piece of paper on top of base with grey, brown and green shading/marks, mostly covered by larger paper forms at center
